page.title: 17Whittington Parish Council
page.content: {The Parish Council}are the main contact between Whittington and the Central Government in London.The Parish Council are the messengers for parishioners to the Borough or County Councils.The Parish Council of Whittington consists of eleven people.There is a chairman who is chosen every year.Elections are held every four years.The Parish Council meet every month except for July when most people are on holiday.The Chairman at the moment is{Mr.John {Carroll.}The Chairman has a badge of office which is an oval,enamelled,medallion given by the {Royal Artillery}as a thank you for the time they spent in the village.The Council is responsible for the maintenances of the castle,lighting and refuse collection.
